example.eg: He tied the horse to the post.
example.egtrans: 他把马拴在柱上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将...扎在, 将...拴在, 将...系在

example.eg: He tied the package with string.
example.egtrans: 他用绳子将包裹绑好。

example.eg: She tied string round the giftbox.
example.egtrans: 她用绳子系住礼盒。

example.eg: The runner tied her shoelaces tightly before starting her jog.
example.egtrans: 慢跑前，她系紧了自己的鞋带。

example.eg: The two teams tied for first place.
example.egtrans: 两队打成了平局。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 平分, 打成平局, 势均力敌

example.eg: They tied the game with the last score.
example.egtrans: 他们在最后一分时把比赛打成了平局。

example.eg: He wore a blue tie to go with his white shirt.
example.egtrans: 他系着蓝领带，配他的白衬衫。

example.eg: Neither team was happy with the 2-2 tie.
example.egtrans: 对于2比2的平局结果，哪队都不满意。

example.eg: My grandma used to tie a piece of string on her finger in order to remember something.
example.egtrans: 我祖母以前为了避免忘事，会在手指上系一根细绳。

example.eg: James put the luggage on the roof rack and tied it on securely.
example.egtrans: 詹姆士把行李绑在车顶行李架上，用力拉紧。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…系在绳上，把…绑在绳上, 系上，绑上

dsense.name: tie
dsense.guideword: (string, etc., for attaching things) (用来系东西的)

example.eg: The tie came loose and the bag dropped.
example.egtrans: 绳子松了，然后袋子掉了。

example.eg: He stays in Ohio because of his family ties.
example.egtrans: 因为他的家庭关系，他待在了俄亥俄州。

example.eg: The metal tie helped hold the structure together.
example.egtrans: 那根金属杆有助于让整个结构固定在一起。

example.eg: To elongate the last note of the measure, there is a tie to the following half note.
example.egtrans: 为了延长最后一个音符的长度，有一根连接到下一个半音符的连接线。

example.eg: Railroad ties support the steel tracks.
example.egtrans: 铁道的枕木支撑着钢轨。

example.eg: Do you prefer a tie or a loafer?
example.egtrans: 你喜欢系带鞋还是懒汉鞋？

example.eg: He tied a knot in his scarf.

dsense.name: tie [sth]⇒
dsense.guideword: mainly US (match in sports) (体育比赛中)

example.eg: The Canadian team tied the French.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 跟…打成平手，与…得分相同, 与...平局

example.eg: He is tied to the job by the golden handcuffs in his contract.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 限制, 约束, 束缚

example.eg: The C is tied over the bar for half a beat.

dsense.name: tie [sth]
dsense.guideword: often passive (connect: musical notes) (音乐术语)

example.eg: The quarter note and the eighth note were tied.
With one day to go until the final vote, the two candidates were tied.
example.egtrans: 距离最后的投票还有一天，两名候选人目前打成平局。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 打成平局，打成平手，并列

example.eg: The politician had to resign because it was discovered that he was tied to the mafia.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 和…有关系, 和…有关联

example.eg: James said they'd got home at 2 am and Paul said the same, so that ties in.
example.egtrans: 詹姆士说他们凌晨两点到的家，保罗说的也一样，这一点上很相符。

example.eg: This pottery fragment is 500 years old, which ties in with what archaeologists believe about the age of the settlement.
This is a great idea, but it doesn't seem to fit with the rest of the novel. I'm not sure we can tie it in.
example.egtrans: 这个主意很不错，不过似乎无法与小说的其他部分连起来。我不知道我们能不能把它连接起来。

example.eg: Our train gets in at 19:00 and the concert starts at 19:30, so that ties in.
You want to meet for lunch? We'll be in town at midday anyway, so yes, that ties in with our plans.
Can you tie out the client's financial statements with his accounts receivable ledger?
These numbers don't tie out.
Joe wrapped the package and tied it up with string.
example.egtrans: 乔将包裹包起来并用绳子捆好。

example.eg: Julia declined the meeting as it would have tied her up for three hours.
example.egtrans: 茱莉亚拒绝了见面，因为这会占用她三个小时的时间。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将…占住, 使无法分身

example.eg: The writer struggled to tie up his complex story.
example.egtrans: 作者想尽办法来完结他复杂的故事。

example.eg: The men had to wear black tie for the company's Christmas dinner.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 黑色领结, 男士宴会正装

example.eg: James looked suave in his black tie outfit.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 打黑领结的, 带黑领结的
需要打领结的, 需要着正装的
饰扣式领带, 波洛领带

example.eg: Alan was wearing a bow tie.
example.egtrans: 艾伦打了一个蝴蝶形领结。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 蝴蝶结, 蝴蝶形领带

example.eg: He's been invited to a bow-tie dinner.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 正式服装的, 正装的

example.eg: Our Sixth Form Prom was a collar and tie event.
Tom and Rachel tied the knot at the church last night.
I won't work in an office that requires me to wear a necktie.

dsense.name: railroad tie
dsense.guideword: US (railway track: sleeper, block supporting track)

example.eg: The volleyball player tied back her long hair so it would not get into her eyes during the tournament.
I got him an elegant gold tie clip for his birthday.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 用绳子将…捆好, 系紧

example.eg: Detectives are trying to tie in the witness accounts and CCTV footage with what they suspect happened.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将...与...联系起来, 将...与...相连

dsense.name: tie [sth] in with [sth], tie in [sth] with [sth]

example.eg: The publishers want to tie in the book launch for the famous poet's biography with the centenary of his death.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将...与...联系起来, 将...和...相连
连接杆, 转向横拉杆

example.eg: When is your sister going to tie the knot?
I love tie-dye; it's so fun and colorful.
I have a lot of tie-dye shirts that I love to wear to school.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 扎染的, 与扎染有关的
周边产品, 衍生产品

example.eg: There's a tie-up on Highway 40.
example.egtrans: 40号高速公路堵车了。

dsense.name: tiebreaker, tie-breaker, also UK: tie-break
dsense.guideword: (sports, game: [sth] that resolves a draw) (体育比赛的)

example.eg: Ron was wearing a white tie with his tux.
